question_1: Can I update my personal details in the app
answer_1: Yes. You can update your profile by going to the ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù section and clicking on ‚ÄúEdit Profile.‚Äù Here you can update details like phone number, email, and address.
question_2: How can I download my admit card through the app?
answer_2: Yes. You can download your admit card by going to the ‚ÄúExam Essentials‚Äù section. Under that, you will find the ‚ÄúAdmit Card‚Äù option. Enter your roll code and roll number to download it.
question_3: Can I upload my certificates and mark sheets in the app?
answer_3: Yes. The app allows you to upload and store your academic certificates, mark sheets, and other documents securely for easy access anytime.
question_4: What kind of exam preparation material is available in the app?
answer_4: The app provides video lectures, e-library books, question banks, previous year papers, and model test papers to help you prepare effectively.
question_5: Will I get updates about exam schedules and results in the app?
answer_5: Yes. All official notifications, exam schedules, and results will be updated in real time under the ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù or ‚ÄúNotifications‚Äù section.
question_6: Can I use the app offline?
answer_6: You need internet access to log in and use most features. However, once you download books, question papers, or video lectures, some content can be accessed offline.
question_7: Is my personal data safe in the app?
answer_7: Yes. The app uses secure encryption and privacy measures to protect your personal details, certificates, and exam records.
question_8: How can I reset my password if I forget it?
answer_8: On the login page, select ‚ÄúForgot Password‚Äù and follow the instructions. You will receive a reset link via SMS or email.
question_9: Can I contact support if I face an issue?
answer_9: Yes. You can raise a query through the ‚ÄúHelp & Support‚Äù section of the app or contact the helpline number/email provided.
question_10: I have been promoted from Class 9 to 10 or 11 to 12. How can I upgrade my profile?
answer_10: Yes. You can upgrade your profile by going to the ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù section, clicking on ‚ÄúEdit,‚Äù and selecting the ‚ÄúUpgrade Class‚Äù option. Just fill in your recent class information.
question_12: When are the BSEB Class 10 and 12 exams conducted?
answer_13: The Matric (Class 10) and Intermediate (Class 12) exams are usually held in February‚ÄìMarch, and results are declared around March‚ÄìApril.
question_14: What should I do if I lose my admit card?
answer_15: If you lose your admit card, immediately inform your school principal. The school can download and provide a duplicate admit card. Without it, you cannot enter the exam hall.
question_16: What is the minimum passing mark in BSEB exams?
answer_17: To pass, you need at least 30% in theory and 40% in practicals in each subject. You must also secure an overall aggregate of 150 marks out of 500 in Class 10.
question_18: What if I fail in one or two subjects?
answer_19: You can appear in the compartmental exam, which is usually conducted in May‚ÄìJune. This gives you a second chance to clear those subjects without wasting a year.
question_20: How do I check my BSEB results online?
answer_21: Go to the official result portal biharboardonline.bihar.gov.in. Enter your roll code and roll number as printed on your admit card. Your result and marksheet will be displayed.
question_22: Is the online marksheet valid for admission?
answer_23: Yes. The digital marksheet available online is valid for admissions and official use. However, you must later collect the original marksheet and certificate from your school or college.
question_24: How can I apply for re-checking or scrutiny of my answer sheets?
answer_25: After results are declared, BSEB opens the scrutiny portal. You can apply online for re-checking of your answer sheets by paying the fee per subject. The updated result is published later.
question_26: Can I change my name, date of birth, or other details in the certificate?
answer_27: Yes, corrections are possible. Submit an application through your school or college with valid proof (such as Aadhaar or birth certificate). BSEB will verify and issue a corrected certificate.
question_28: How do I prepare for BSEB board exams effectively?
answer_29:
Study from NCERT or Board prescribed books.
- Solve previous year question papers.
- Revise regularly, focusing more on weak subjects.
- Practice time management with mock tests.
- Stay consistent rather than relying on last-minute studying.
question_30: What is the process for marksheet or certificate correction?
answer_31: To correct errors in your marksheet or certificate, students must apply through their respective school/college and follow the correction guidelines issued by BSEB. The application is then verified and forwarded to the board for necessary updates.
question_32: How can I correct mistakes in my BSEB registration form?
answer_33: Registration form correction can be done only during the correction period announced through the official notification by BSEB. Students should contact their school/college to make the corrections within the given timeframe.
